page.title: 07CROMBIE SCHOOL
page.content: Crombie School, which was opened in 1928, now has a population of only{14} boys and{9}girls, although the janitor recalled a time when there were{68} pupils in the school. Because of this declining role, there are only two full time teachers, although 4 part time teachers, 1 secretary, 1 cook, and the lady janitor, also help the school to run efficiently. The two classes, ages 5-8 and 9-12, work in well equipped rooms, with plenty of space elsewhere in the building for project work, cooking etc. The pupils all live within Crombie village itself, or on nearby farms, and they are like one big family. When the pupils leave Crombie, they go to either Woodmill High School or to Queen Anne High School, both in Dunfermline, for their secondary education.
